captions.text:
Jamie, one game to go, how are you feeling
about it? People keep asking me but it's...I

suppose the answer will come after the game
really. I just want to concentrate on the

game, looking forward to it and get my ticket
sorted and hopefully get a win and I can look

back on it and give you a better answer. Have
you at any time reconsidered retirement or

has Brendan asked you to reconsider? No, not
really. We had a couple of chats on different

things over the season really, not just since
I made my decision but the more I've been

in the team the more I've wanted to stick
with my decision and go out playing. I've

been quite fortunate with the timing, when
I announced it I kept my self in the side

and I can go out playing which is something
I prefer rather than maybe staying another

year and being on the stand or on the bench
or wherever it may be. What then is the best

moment of your Liverpool career? Istanbul,
nothing will beat that will it? Champions

League final, no point in going over the game
we all know what happened that night, it was

difficult to ever top that. What was it like
that night to lift the European Cup? I've

never won the league, that was a disappointment
and if we'd have won that then maybe I could

have compared the two but we've won FA Cups,
Carling Cups, UEFA Cup but nothing compares

to the Champions League. Its the biggest and
best trophy you can win in football and thats

what we achieved. \
We should have won the league, you know, but

you know, you've given everything and you've
given as much as you can in terms of what

you've put into it, its a team game, different
managers, coaches helped you along the way

and you do your best and I've done alright.
\

You still have big gaps, have you got other
stuff that maybe you want to do, get on the

golf course or go scuba-diving? He's a bit
nosey this fella isn't he? F**king hell...I
don't know! F**king hell...}

title: Carragher swears at reporter and labels him 'nosey'

comments.text:
+Cloud ffvii PKP I come from Canada my friend.  I have absolutely no 
inferiority complex.  I love my massive beautiful country that is not over 
crowded in any way or rife with civil strife .  I feel sorry for the rest 
of the world for not having a country like Canada to be proud of.  I am 
always so happy to come home when I have to leave what truly is the 
greatest and most beautiful part of the entire planet.  Our economy is 
working out beautifully, we weathered the recession better than every other 
western country because we are not retarded like the rest of you.  You and 
the UK have nothing at all on me and my country.  We are doing absolutely 
fine and are not envious of you in the slightest way...In Canada people are 
more likely to mock the UK and English people specifically than to praise 
them.  Some people are nice and don't do that.  The reason I cheer for 
England is because my parents come from England, so there is some cause for 
pride there.

 The only reason why EPL is any good is because of all the foreign players,

Born in Salford, moved to Ireland with my Irish Mum and English Dad when I 
was 18 months. Lived there for 5 years. Came home for another 6 years, 
parents divorced, lived in Ireland with my Mum until I was was 16 and then 
moved back for my GCSEs and then University. So yes I have the luxury of 
both having an Irish heritage and English heritage which I'm equally proud 
of so often change between them :) Liverpool fans aren't big headed? "This 
is our year. 5 Times. Most successful team in England"..

comments.text:
Every successful club in the world in every single sport will have a 
majority of supporters outside of their local area. Manchester United are 
not unique in that respect. The number of Liverpool supporters in Asia will 
undoubtedly outnumber the number of Liverpool fans in Liverpool (Asia is 
bigger, see).If you bothered to do your own research, you'd know though 
that over 50% of Mancunians are United fans according to every survey. And 
we are proud of our team, wherever they are in the table.

comments.text:
1. Sweet Jesus, I hope your name does not refer to your year of birth 2. 
No, because Carragher's commitment to Liverpool depended on him being 
offered a professional contract. Gary Neville's did not and still does not.
comments.author: andragonous

comments.text:
"1. I am not your mate"...ok then...prick, that better? Whilst you climb 
down off your high horse I'll reiterate my point that Neville can be 
compared to because Carragher was every bit as committed to his club. 
Neville was not unique or special in that respect.
comments.author: Stevieboy74

comments.text:
1. I am not your mate. 2. I said nothing about his professionalism, and 
neither did the comment I responded to. I was talking about the comparison 
with Gary Neville and how the level of commitment to the club cannot be 
compared. Gary Neville was 100% devoted to United whether he was a rich 
footballer or a young fan in awe of his heroes. That simply cannot be said 
of Jamie Carragher.
comments.author: andragonous

comments.text:
What and because Neville supported Utd that made him more devoted and 
dedicated to his team that he played for as a professional? Don't talk shit 
mate. You will not find a player more devoted to a team all his 
professional career than Jamie Carragher. There are others, such as Neville 
and Gerrard etc, but Carragher is just as good.
comments.author: Stevieboy74

really comparable.

comments.text:
before his real madrid days, carlos played for roy hodgson's 1995-96 inter 
milan team :) roy hodgson wanted to turn carlos into a left winger due to 
his attacking abilities.... however, roberto carlos didn't like the 
position and saw himself as an attacking full-back only, and that was 
actually part of the big reason he left inter for real madrid :) so in his 
case, he actually wanted to be a full-back :D
comments.author: Reuben Jones

comments.text:
depends what u mean... talent?? id say carragher was probably a better 
player than neville yes :) as for the latter part, i agree, not many people 
dream of playin full-back, however... gary neville did respond with a good 
point to be fair when he said 'can we get roberto carlos in here?' and 
before u say roberto carlos was a failed winger... while u might assume 
that by the way he played.... here's an interesting fact... ...which ill 
type in the next message as this aint long enough lol
